summary: This document outlines the decision-making procedures and meeting protocols for the Americas Region Reputational Risk Committee (ARRC) of Deutsche Bank. It details how decisions are made, the responsibilities of the Committee Secretary, and the frequency and attendance expectations for meetings. The document emphasizes the importance of maintaining a log of conditions of approval and ensuring that members are informed of the reputational risk profile.
keyFacts: The ARRC makes decisions by consensus, with majority ruling in case of conflict.
The Committee Secretary is responsible for maintaining an inventory of open items and a Conditions Logbook.
Meetings are held on an ad hoc and quarterly basis to review reputational risk and related issues.
Attendance at meetings is recorded, and members are expected to attend a majority of meetings.
Delegates may only attend meetings if explicitly nominated by an ARRC member.
